exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 1 branch or a conjunctive pattern made of 2 patterns.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall x y : R, in_ucp_set x y -> in_ucp_setb x y

Premises:
in_ucp_set = fun x y : R => exists p q : Z, (x = fst (ucp p q) /\ y = snd (ucp p q) \/ x = snd (ucp p q) /\ y = fst (ucp p q)) /\ cond_pq p q : R -> R -> Prop Arguments in_ucp_set (_ _)%R_scope
*** [ R : Set ]
in_ucp_setb = fun x y : R => exists p q : Z, x = fst (ucp p q) /\ y = snd (ucp p q) /\ cond_pqb p q : R -> R -> Prop Arguments in_ucp_setb (_ _)%R_scope
rat_pos_coo2 : forall x y : R, is_ucp (x, y) -> in_ucp_setb x y
exp_inv : forall x y : R, exp x = exp y -> x = y
OMEGA6 : forall x y z : Z, 0 <= x -> y = 0 -> 0 <= x + y * z
constant = fun f : R -> R => forall x y : R, f x = f y : (R -> R) -> Prop Arguments constant _%function_scope
rat_pos_coo1 : forall x y : R, is_ucp (x, y) -> exists r : R, is_rat r /\ (r >= 0)%R /\ (r <= 1)%R /\ x = fst (p2 r) /\ y = snd (p2 r)
decreasing = fun f : R -> R => forall x y : R, (x <= y)%R -> (f y <= f x)%R : (R -> R) -> Prop Arguments decreasing _%function_scope
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
increasing = fun f : R -> R => forall x y : R, (x <= y)%R -> (f x <= f y)%R : (R -> R) -> Prop Arguments increasing _%function_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
R_dist = fun x y : R => Rabs (x - y) : R -> R -> R Arguments R_dist (_ _)%R_scope
fast_Zred_factor5 : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P y -> P (x * 0 + y)
Z.gt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.ge = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.ge (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => match y with | 0 => Eq | Z.pos _ => Lt | Z.neg _ => Gt end | Z.pos x' => match y with | Z.pos y' => (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Gt end | Z.neg x' => match y with | Z.neg y' => CompOpp (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Lt end end : Z -> Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
Rderivable_pt_abs : forall x : R, x <> 0%R -> derivable_pt Rabs x
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
Rabs_pos_eq : forall x : R, (0 <= x)%R -> Rabs x = x
Rabs_derive_2 : forall x : R, (x < 0)%R -> derivable_pt_lim Rabs x (-1)%R
Rabs_derive_1 : forall x : R, (0 < x)%R -> derivable_pt_lim Rabs x 1%R
R_dist_eq : forall x : R, R_dist x x = 0%R
exp_ln : forall x : R, (0 < x)%R -> exp (ln x) = x
ln_exp : forall x : R, ln (exp x) = x
Rabs_Ropp : forall x : R, Rabs (- x) = Rabs x
is_upper_bound = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => forall x : R, E x -> (x <= m)%R : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Arguments is_upper_bound _%function_scope _%R_scope
exp_pos : forall x : R, (0 < exp x)%R
antiderivative = fun (f g : R -> R) (a b : R) => (forall x : R, (a <= x <= b)%R -> exists pr : derivable_pt g x, f x = derive_pt g x pr) /\ (a <= b)%R : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Arguments antiderivative (_ _)%function_scope (_ _)%R_scope
completeness : forall E : R -> Prop, bound E -> (exists x : R, E x) -> {m : R | is_lub E m}
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments snd {A B}%type_scope

```coq
intros x y H.
unfold in_ucp_set in H.
unfold in_ucp_setb.
destruct H as [p [q [[H1 H2] | [H1 H2]]]].
- exists p, q.
  split.
  + apply H1.
  + split. 
    * apply H2.
    * apply H2.
- exists q, p.
  split.
  + apply H2.
  + split.
    * apply H1.
    * apply H1.
Qed.
```

original: intros x y H. unfold in_ucp_set in H. unfold in_ucp_setb. destruct H as [p [q [[H1 H2] | [H1 H2]]]]. - exists p, q. split. + apply H1. + split. * apply H2. * apply H2. - exists q, p. split. + apply H2. + split. * apply H1. * apply H1.
